techmeme.title: The Biden administration's big bet on Intel to lead a US chipmaking revival is in trouble as Intel struggles to meet milestones for receiving CHIPS Act grants (Mackenzie Hawkins/Bloomberg)
Sources: Intel's contract manufacturing business has suffered a setback after tests with chipmaker Broadcom using Intel's advanced 18A chipmaking process failed (Max A. Cherney/Reuters)
Meta's Oversight Board rules that the phrase "from the river to the sea" is not necessarily hate speech when addressing the Israeli-Palestinian conflict (David Ingram/NBC News)
Spotify expands daylist, a personalized playlist that evolves through the day depending on listening habits, globally for free and adds support for 14 languages (Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch)
Alibaba will let shoppers check out via Tencent's WeChat Pay on its Taobao and Tmall shopping platforms, as Chinese government crackdown on Alibaba ends (Bloomberg)
